topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/555e570d63687226f1920300#post_555e570d63687226f1920300
Not really; I personally like VR and that, but I just think that chances are a lot of parents are going to get their kids VR when it gets cheaper thinking that letting 5 year olds use something that is potentially heavily addictive for 40 hours a week will have no repercussions.

If parents use it as the new substitute baby sitter considering how addictive it is that *might* fuck them up.

You, me and most of the people here know enough to not play games to the point that you're ditching work and school, *but* if parents use it as a substitute for young children that might go poorly.

I just hope they don't go the "why have a baby sitter when you can buy your kid vr equipment route to shut them up?" route cause that might go poorly.
